medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening abdominal pain, occasionally accompanied by chest pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has a several year history of abdominal pain that has recently worsened. The abdominal pain is diffuse and includes the groin bilaterally. Over the last several days, the pain in the left lower quadrant (LLQ) has become more severe. The patient reports chronic constipation and improvement after bowel movements. He denies worsening with food or straining, physical exertion, and has not experienced emesis, melena, hematochezia, or diarrhea.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension (HTN), Hyperlipidemia (HLD), Coronary Artery Disease (CAD) status post Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI), Aortic Stenosis (AS), Diverticulosis, Depression/Anxiety, Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH), Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD), Paget's Disease, Hip Arthroplasty, Meniere's Disease.
